availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel G. Suddarth (Quarter-master General of Kentucky)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Amanda F. Baker Suddarth in Adair County on January 18, 1848. Married to Nancy B. Baker Suddarth in April 1859. Father of Clay Suddarth, Tyler Suddarth, Samuel Suddarth, and James Suddarth. Attorney in Adair County in 1850. Attorney in Adair County in 1860. Quartermaster General of Kentucky from September 1, 1863 to January 13, 1866.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film #000830576, p. 106 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, 60A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 153.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), VII.
